trans-unit.source: Encapsulates security decisions about an application.
This class cannot be inherited.
An ApplicationTrust object is returned by a trust manager's <xref:System.Security.Policy.IApplicationTrustManager.DetermineApplicationTrust%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> class.
This constructor creates an empty <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> class with an <xref href="System.ApplicationIdentity"></xref>.
An application identity contains the full name of the application and the location of its code base.
An <xref href="System.ApplicationIdentity"></xref> that uniquely identifies an application.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> class using the provided grant set and collection of full-trust assemblies.
`fullTrustAssemblies` identifies strong-named assemblies within the <xref:System.AppDomain> that are to be granted full trust.
This constructor is called by the <xref:System.AppDomain.CreateDomain%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create an <xref:System.AppDomain> that will be used as a sandbox.
For more information about running an application in a sandbox, see [How to: Run Partially Trusted Code in a Sandbox](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A default permission set that is granted to all assemblies that do not have specific grants.
An array of strong names that represent assemblies that should be considered fully trusted in an application domain.
fullTrustAssemblies is .
fullTrustAssemblies contains an assembly that does not have a .
Gets or sets the application identity for the application trust object.
The ApplicationIdentity property uniquely identifies a manifest-based application to be activated in a new domain.
An <xref href="System.ApplicationIdentity"></xref> for the application trust object.
<xref href="System.ApplicationIdentity"></xref> cannot be set because it has a value of <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Creates a new object that is a complete copy of the current instance.
A duplicate copy of this application trust object.
Gets or sets the policy statement defining the default grant set.
The DefaultGrantSet property represents the permissions that are granted to the application.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement> representing the default grants is initialized using a <xref:System.Security.PermissionSet> and optional attributes.
A <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> describing the default grants.
Gets or sets extra security information about the application.
An object containing additional security information about the application.
Reconstructs an <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object with a given state from an XML encoding.

The <xref:System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable.ToXml%2A> and <xref:System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable.FromXml%2A> methods are implemented to make <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects XML-encodable for security policy use.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object.
element is .
The XML encoding used for element is invalid.
Gets the list of full-trust assemblies for this application trust.
The list identifies assemblies that are to be granted full trust within the <xref:System.AppDomain> that is associated with this <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> instance.
The assemblies are identified by their strong names.
A list of full-trust assemblies.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the application has the required permission grants and is trusted to run.
A trust manager sets the IsApplicationTrustedToRun property to `true` when an application has been approved to execute.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the application is trusted to run; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether application trust information is persisted.
When the Persist property is `true`, application trust information is saved to the ClickOnce application store.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if application trust information is persisted; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates an XML encoding of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object and its current state.

The <xref:System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable.ToXml%2A> and <xref:System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable.FromXml%2A> methods are implemented to make <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects XML-encodable for security policy use.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
